headline: Citi names insider Raymond Gatcliffe as CEO of Canada operations
summary: Gatcliffe, whose appointment is effective April 1, succeeds CEO John Hastings, who will stay on as a member of the board.  The leadership change comes amid a shake up of the decades-old global trade order triggered by sweeping tariffs from U.S. President Donald Trump.  Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney on Thursday reiterated that Ottawa would respond with force until Washington lifted the tariffs.

headline: Is Citigroup Worth a Spot in Your Portfolio Ahead of Q1 Earnings?
summary: C's first-quarter 2025 results will likely reflect the benefits of a rise in NII and loan demand. Yet, rising costs are likely to have hurt.

headline: Raymond Gatcliffe appointed Country Officer and Chief Executive Officer for Citibank Canada
summary: Raymond Gatcliffe has been appointed Country Officer and Chief Executive Officer for Citibank Canada, effective April 1, 2025. He succeeds John Hastings who will stay on as a member of the Citibank Canada Board of Directors.

raw.headline: Raymond Gatcliffe appointed Country Officer and Chief Executive Officer for Citibank Canada
raw.summary: Raymond Gatcliffe has been appointed Country Officer and Chief Executive Officer for Citibank Canada, effective April 1, 2025. He succeeds John Hastings who will stay on as a member of the Citibank Canada Board of Directors.

headline: Wall Street Execs Privately Credit Dimon and Ackman for Swaying Trump on Tariffs
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Wall Street has gotten its way for decades, Scott Bessent argued Wednesday morning, declaring “It’s Main Street’s turn.” Then Wall Street had its best day in 16 years.Hours after the Treasury secretary’s full-throated defense of Donald Trump’s “Liberation Day” tariffs, the president embraced an idea pushed by billionaire hedge funder Bill Ackman: Pause the levies for 90 days, rather than — as Ackman put it — risking a “self-induced, economic nuclear winter.”For days, Ackman’s prop

headline: Citigroup (C) Soars 9.2%: Is Further Upside Left in the Stock?
summary: Citigroup (C) witnessed a jump in share price last session on above-average trading volume. The latest trend in earnings estimate revisions for the stock doesn't suggest further strength down the road.

headline: Trump is already slowing global trade as companies pause orders
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Supply Lines is a daily newsletter that tracks global trade. Sign up here.US President Donald Trump may have announced a delay in some of his tariff plans, but the first signs of an economically-damaging slowdown in global trade are already emerging as companies around the world hit their own pause button on orders and he continues to escalate his trade war with China.
